Hello James,

In cactus they have a step by step tutorial on how to test EJ=
B's.  If you need some help
on learning EJBs and what to test the java.sun.=
com EJB tutorial is a good place to start.
Here you will come up with some =
ideas on what to test.  EJBs are a quite extensive topic
depending on how y=
ou see it, try to focus on something first then expand your knowledge on
th=
e other subjects of EJBs, ie: start with Session EJBs and return a simple "=
Hello world".

As part of the research project you may want to say that dif=
ferent tools are for different
kinds of test for what I would also look and=
 briefly explain other tools like jmeter, junitperf,
httpunit, etc...

Good=
 luck on your research project sounds like you will have some fun,

--Rene =
Baltazar Lopez

Subject: [junit] JUnit and EJB! please help, a beginner


Hi 

I am a =
graduate student at a local university. I was just given a 
research projec=
t on how to do both unit testing and load testing of

explore the possibility of using JUnit to unit 
test EJB.

I must say that =
I am still pretty new at this EJB, tomcat, and 
JUnit. my previous programm=
ing experience has been java IO,applet, 
swing, and some servlet.

Can any =
of you guys give a pointer on where is the best place to 
start looking for=
 simple sample codes to run and play with ? I look 
into jakarta.cactus web=
site, but they don;t offer step by step 
instructions on how to begin testi=
ng ejb. I don't even know how to 
pack EAR, WAR, or jar file. 

any help wo=
uld be greatly appreciated
